page.title: 04HANBURY HALL
page.content: Hanbury Hall is a very large and beautiful country house built at the beginning of the{eighteeth century.}It was built by{Thomas Vernon}and the date 1701 appears above the front door .{The house now belongs to the {National Trust}and is open to visitors. The land of Hanbury belonged to the Bishop of Worcester at the time of the first Domesday Survey. It was bought by the Vernon family in 1631. The present building was started soon after that time. The rooms sre very large and in the house there are many engravings and paintings and a beautiful staircase. There is also some fine furniture. The parkland is now used for grazing cattle and horses. A nearby public house is called the Vernon Arms.
